cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem.jobshop
Class JobShop

java.lang.Object
  cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem.BaseProblem
      cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem.jobshop.JobShop
All Implemented Interfaces:
GlobalSearchProblem, Problem, RandomConfigurationProblem, StartingConfigurationProblem
public class JobShop
extends BaseProblem
implements StartingConfigurationProblem, RandomConfigurationProblem, GlobalSearchProblem

Job Shop Scheduling problem.

Definition:

We are given n jobs J1, J2, .. Jn, each takes different amount of time to finish (time is integer).

Then we have m identical machines, each capable of running single job at one time.

Goal is to assign jobs to machines such that total time is minimal.

Worse possible time is time(J1)+time(J2)+...+time(Jn). Best time cannot be better than (time(J1)+time(J2)+...+time(Jn))/m (rounded up), where m is number of machines.

Total time for this definition of Job Shop Scheduling problem is highest sum of times on one machine across all machines.

Starting configuration for Job Shop is to have all jobs on first machine, eg. worst possible time.

There are several extension to JobShop problem, for example Ji cannot start before Jj starts (or finishes).

moveOperations

protected java.util.List<java.util.List<MoveOperation>> moveOperations
List of all possible move operations.

First index is which job to move, second is to which machine to move. Therefore outer list has BaseProblem.dimension elements, while every inner list has machines elements.

getOperationIterator

public JobShopIterator getOperationIterator(Configuration configuration)
Description copied from interface: Problem
Returns iterator for operations which are allowed for supplied attributes.

This iterator should be lazy initialized! If not, you are running into risk of performance problems (some algorithms creates lots of configurations and asks operationIterator for all of them).

Specified by:
